requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A visitor interested in browsing upcoming fishing contests.
user_goal: To view a list of upcoming contests by navigating to the Contests page.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Contests Page
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the website and sees the main navigation menu. She wants to see upcoming fishing contests, so she clicks the 'Contests' link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Contests' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads and displays a list of contest cards fetched dynamically from the /api/contests endpoint.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Contest Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah finds an interesting contest and decides to learn more by clicking on its card.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a contest card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is taken to the detailed contest page populated with data fetched from the /api/contests/{id} endpoint.

requirement_tested: A backend application that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer deploying the backend service.
user_goal: To confirm the backend can successfully connect to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: The developer sets the required environment variables and starts the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Run the backend server with correct environment variables set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server logs show successful connection to PostgreSQL database at localhost:5432 with username 'myappuser' and database 'myapp'.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing API Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Developer makes a GET request to retrieve contests to verify database connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to /api/contests endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a successful JSON response containing contest data retrieved from the connected PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Contest announcement posting functionality with title, description, date, and registration details
user_persona: An administrator managing the fishing contest website.
user_goal: To post a new fishing contest announcement with all relevant details.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Panel
narrative_steps.description: Admin logs into the admin panel and navigates to the 'Post New Contest' section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the contest creation form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form with fields for title, description, date, registration deadline, location, and prizes is displayed.

narrative_steps.title: Filling and Submitting Form
narrative_steps.description: Admin fills out all the required fields for the new contest and hovers over the submit button before clicking it.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in form fields and click the Submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: On hover, the button shade changes slightly. Upon clicking, the form data is sent via POST to /api/admin/contests and the contest is added to the database.

requirement_tested: Contest results display functionality showing participant rankings and scores
user_persona: A participant eager to check his performance in a recent fishing contest.
user_goal: To view the results of a specific contest and see where he ranks.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Results Section
narrative_steps.description: Mark visits the website and clicks on the 'Results' tab to find the latest contest results.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Results' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He is directed to a page displaying a table of results fetched from the /api/results endpoint.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Results Table
narrative_steps.description: Mark wants to sort the results by score to quickly see the top performers.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Score' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The table reorders to display participants sorted by score in descending order.

requirement_tested: Contest photo gallery showcasing images from various contests
user_persona: A photography enthusiast looking for contest highlights.
user_goal: To browse through photos submitted from past fishing contests.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Photo Gallery
narrative_steps.description: Jenny clicks on the 'Photos' link in the navigation bar to explore contest images.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Photos' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A grid-based gallery of thumbnails loads, pulling images from the /api/photos endpoint.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Image in Lightbox
narrative_steps.description: Jenny finds a stunning photo and clicks on it to get a better look.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a thumbnail image.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The image opens in a lightbox overlay with navigation arrows, allowing her to view it in full size.

requirement_tested: User browsing capability for contest announcements, results, and photos
user_persona: A regular visitor interested in exploring different aspects of the site.
user_goal: To filter content by type using the available tabs.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Different Content Types
narrative_steps.description: Tom lands on the home page and wants to switch between viewing contest announcements, results, and photos.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Announcements', 'Results', and 'Photos' tabs sequentially.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each tab click updates the content area dynamically, showing the appropriate data fetched from respective APIs without reloading the page.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Specific Contests
narrative_steps.description: Tom uses the search bar to find contests related to 'Lake Fishing'.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Lake Fishing' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The contest list updates to show only those matching the search query, fetched via /api/contests with the query parameter applied.

requirement_tested: User registration functionality for signing up to participate in contests
user_persona: A new angler wanting to join an upcoming fishing contest.
user_goal: To register for a specific contest using the multi-step registration form.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Registration Process
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on the 'Register' button on a contest page and begins filling out the registration form.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Register' button and start entering personal information.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The first step of the registration form appears with fields for name and email, styled with teal buttons for navigation.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Registration
narrative_steps.description: After filling in his details, Alex clicks 'Next' to proceed to the preferences section, then completes the registration.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Next' to go to preferences, select options, and click 'Submit'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form progresses through steps logically. On final submission, data is posted to /api/registrations and Alex receives a confirmation.

requirement_tested: Contest information pages displaying details like rules, prizes, and schedules
user_persona: A potential contestant wanting to understand contest guidelines.
user_goal: To read about the contest rules and schedule before deciding to register.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Contest Detail Page
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on a contest card and lands on the contest detail page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a contest card from the main list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with collapsible sections for Rules, Schedule, Prizes, and Registration Info, styled with mint cream and teal.

narrative_steps.title: Expanding Sections for More Info
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on the 'Rules' section title to expand it and read the contest regulations.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Rules' section header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The section expands to reveal the detailed textual rules fetched from the contest data.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with mint cream background and teal colored elements
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the website on a smartphone.
user_goal: To navigate the website comfortably on a small screen device.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Site on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Pat opens the fishing contest website on her phone to check upcoming events.
narrative_steps.action: Open the website on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The site renders responsively with a mint cream background and teal-colored interactive elements adapting to the smaller screen.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting contests, participants, results, and photo galleries
user_persona: A database administrator setting up the backend database.
user_goal: To initialize the database schema with proper tables and relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Database Tables
narrative_steps.description: The DBA runs the SQL script to create tables for contests, participants, results, and photos.
narrative_steps.action: Execute the provided CREATE TABLE statements in PostgreSQL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables named contests, participants, results, and photos are created with appropriate columns and foreign key constraints.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for fetching contest data, submitting registrations, and retrieving results
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: To consume backend APIs for displaying contest-related data.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Contest Data
narrative_steps.description: Developer writes code to fetch contest data for display on the frontend.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to /api/contests.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives a JSON response with a list of contests that can be rendered in the UI.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration
narrative_steps.description: Developer implements form submission logic to send user registration data.
narrative_steps.action: Send a POST request to /api/registrations with registration data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend processes the request and returns a success response indicating the registration was saved.

requirement_tested: User interface for administrators to post new contest announcements
user_persona: An authenticated admin managing contest content.
user_goal: To create a new contest announcement using the admin interface.

narrative_steps.title: Logging into Admin Interface
narrative_steps.description: Admin accesses the protected route to create new contest announcements.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to admin contest creation page after authentication.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A rich form with fields for contest details and WYSIWYG editor is presented for creating a new contest entry.

narrative_steps.title: Saving New Contest
narrative_steps.description: Admin fills in the contest details and saves the new announcement.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Save button after completing the form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form data is submitted via POST to /api/admin/contests and the new contest appears in the public contest list.

requirement_tested: Photo upload and management system for contest images
user_goal: To upload and manage photos for a recently concluded contest.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading Contest Photos
narrative_steps.description: Organizer drags and drops multiple contest photos into the upload zone.
narrative_steps.action: Drag and drop image files into the designated upload area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Files begin uploading immediately via POST to /api/photos/upload and appear as previews with delete options.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Unwanted Images
narrative_steps.description: Upon reviewing the uploads, organizer removes one image that was accidentally included.
narrative_steps.action: Click the delete icon on an unwanted image preview.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The image is removed both from the preview and deleted from backend storage.

requirement_tested: Registration form capturing user details like name, email, and contest preferences
user_persona: A user registering for a fishing contest.
user_goal: To sign up for a contest by providing personal information and preferences.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Registration Information
narrative_steps.description: User fills out the registration form with name, email, and selects preferred contest gear.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in registration form fields and select preference options.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All fields are clearly labeled and styled with the mint cream and teal theme, making it easy to complete.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration
narrative_steps.description: After filling in the last field, user presses Enter to submit the form.
narrative_steps.action: Press Enter key in the last input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form validates inputs and submits the data to /api/registrations, confirming successful registration.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with npm run install:all and npm run dev scripts
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To easily install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Developer clones the repository and runs the unified install command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer starts both frontend and backend development servers with one command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start concurrently, ready for development and testing.
